VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period and compliance with the CAP is as follows:
2022C0325018 cited R 400.4166 for moving youth from Optimist House to Mott
Children Residence without obtaining authorization and completing required
documentation. During this inspection review, authorization and required
documentation were completed for a youth that moved from Optimist House to
Mott Children Residence and for youths that moved from Mott Children Residence
to Optimist House. Compliance is achieved.
Financial Overview
Whaley Children's Center 2022 financial audit was reviewed. Financial concerns
are not noted. Whaley Children’s Center 2023 financial audit is in progress.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator completed an annual assessment and corrective action plan
dated 02/08/2024. It highlights the following: 1.) Staff completed BBI Six Core
Strategies training. This training is now part of their new hire training curriculum.
2.) Therapeutic Crisis Intervention refresher training is now required quarterly for
staff. 3.) Each youth has an Individualized Crisis Support Plan. Staff are required
to review each Individual Crisis Support Plan weekly to gain strategies in working
with the youths.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One supervisor and one staff were interviewed. Both were knowledgeable about
Optimist House policy and procedures and the youths. Neither expressed
concerns.
One Optimist House youth was interviewed. Youth reported feeling safe and did
not express concerns.

Description of Agency Walk Through
A tour of Optimist House was completed on 04/09/2024. The house was neat and
orderly. Youth bedrooms were also neat and orderly.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
